title: Lead Americas Equity Derivatives Programme Manager
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.


This is a significant undertaking and high profile in nature and as such we are looking for a senior Technologist with hands-on experience managing Structured Equity Derivatives projects and designing and delivering end to end solutions.


As our Lead Americas Equity Derivatives Program Manager you will:


* Form direct relationships with trading desks, technology teams and leadership
* Excellent analysis, design and development skills. Able to lead a team in an Agile environment within a Dev-Ops framework
* Manage programs strategy and the program approach across a series of projects or component activities, building stakeholder buy-in around plans, commitments and changes
* Assist business stakeholders with the decomposition of complex business requirements into Epics and User Stories that can be delivered by Tech teams via respective backlogs with minimum cross product co-ordination
* Delivery, governance & reporting to stakeholders including the Product owner in the business, head of a service line or Product within Technology
* Drive the use of Agile methodologies within Technology teams (e.g. Scrum, Kanban, Lean) in line with corresponding transformation frameworks at the bank
* Ensure Technology programs align to HSBC strategies and contribute to towards achieving strategic aims
* Manage the development and promotion of the technology portfolio and project management practices
* Manage the reporting of progress, issues, dependencies and risks to committees and make recommendations to influence decision making in order to maintain progress towards delivery and benefits realization

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $160,000.00 and $220,000.00.


The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.


At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:


* Excellent analysis, design and development skills. Able to lead a team in an Agile environment within a Dev-Ops framework
* Able to drive a team forward but also be able to roll up his or her sleeves and drive the program forwards
* Ability to learn fast and rapidly assimilate new business requirements
* Organized, self-starter, highly motivated team player
* 10+ years of experience in Investment Banking with strong understanding/relevant experience of Prime Brokerage with a particular focus on
* Structured Equity Derivatives
* Able to converse with key business stakeholders around Derivatives business concepts
* Experience writing functional specifications
* Experience with SQL

In compliance with applicable laws, HSBC is committed to employing only those who are authorized to work in the US. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. as HSBC will not engage in immigration sponsorship for this position.


As an HSBC employee, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities to ensure you have the right skills for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive pay and benefits package including a robust Wellness Hub, all in a welcoming, diverse and inclusive work environment. You will be empowered to drive HSBC’s engagement with the communities we serve through an industry-leading volunteerism policy, a generous matching gift program, and a comprehensive program of immersive Sustainability and Climate Change Initiatives. You’ll want to join our Employee Resource Groups as they play a central part in life at HSBC, including the development of our employees and networking inside and outside of HSBC. We value difference. We succeed together. We take responsibility. We get it done. And we want you to help us build the bank of the future!


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, race, national origin, ethnicity, disability or medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran service, religion, creed, sex, gender, pregnancy, childbirth, caregiver status, marital status, citizenship or immigration status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other trait protected by applicable law.
company_description: HSBC is one of the world’s largest banking and financial services organisations. We serve more than 40 million customers across a network that covers 64 countries and territories.

title: Citizen Watch Company, 5th Avenue Flagship - Full-Time Keyholder
description:
**Citizen Watch America** represents the sales and marketing for the Citizen Group within the U.S., Caribbean and Latin American markets. The brands included within Citizen Watch America are Citizen, Bulova, Frederique Constant, Alpina, and Ateliers deMonaco. Each individual brand builds upon their very distinctive identities in the market with their unique, differentiated advertising, marketing and brand campaigns. As a combined company, however, the brands can assist each other and leverage the power that a larger unified entity brings.

Our vision is to lead the affordable luxury watch market by offering the most compelling collection of brands and products that are loved, favored, and respected by citizens of the world.

We will continue to leverage our heritage and expertise to enrich the lives of our current and future customers and Employees through unparalleled excellence in creativity, design, craftsmanship, innovation, technology, value, and service.

**Summary**

The Full Time Key Holder assists the management team in motivating hand inspiring their team to achieve store productivity goals. They assist the management team to develop action plans and analyze daily, weekly, and monthly sales.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** *include the following. Other duties may be assigned.*

* Work as part of the management team to achieve the store’s sales plans through consistent sales motivation, staff training, and customer service.
* Achieve personal sales goals.
* Develop a selling culture in the store.
* Model exemplary selling techniques and customer service.
* Works as part of the management team to train, supervise, and develop all store associates in customer service, clientele, company history, product knowledge, visual merchandising, and store operations.
* Leads team to ensure that all members of the store team are goal oriented, motivated and productive.
* Insures that all case lines are clean, pricing is correct and product is well merchandised.
* Responsible for managing the store when the General Manager and Assistant Manager are not there.
* Maintains adequate sales floor coverage.
* Assist the management team to track and ensure that KPI metrics are clearly communicated and achieved.
* Work with management team to ensure that sales associates are developing and maintaining long-term clients through the effective use of customer service.

**Qualifications**

* Flexible with work schedule to work days, evenings, weekends, per the needs of the business.
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) preferred; or one to three years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Retail jewelry and watch experience highly desirable.

EEOE

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

title: VP, Brand Marketing, Wall Street Journal
description:
**Job Description:**


VP, Brand Marketing, The Wall Street Journal


Where am I based?


New York, NY


Who is my manager?


SVP, Brand Marketing


The Wall Street Journal brand marketing team is looking for a Marketing VP who will manage marketing campaigns that drive awareness and consideration for the Journal brand among prospect audiences. The VP Marketing will manage a team of world class marketers, as well as an internal and external agency. You will oversee all marketing activity across the whole customer lifecycle from brand strategy, campaign marketing to direct response. This is a highly visible, influential role that will ensure marketing supports and delivers on all critical business goals. The ideal candidate will have 15+ years experience working in a global brand or digital subscription business, driving a high performing team to produce results and be passionate about news and the news business.


Responsibilities:


* Work closely with the SVP of Marketing to provide guidance on strategic and creative initiatives.
* Mange a dynamic team of 10+ marketeers, from content/product to brand marketing
* Lead and empower a team of marketers to drive relevance, trust and consideration for the Wall Street Journal brand across the marketing funnel, as well as other Dow Jones brands such as Barron's, MarketWatch, Investor's Business Daily, etc.
* Take responsibility for the creative philosophy and the standard of output across the brand as well as serve as the brand steward for WSJ, responsible for managing brand and creative alignment across the organization.
* Set the vision and lead an in-house and external agency to produce a large volume of assets across all marketing channels.
* Champion customer needs across all aspects of the funnel and operationalize insights.
* Ensure the marketing team has a strong connection with the News department to ensure the brand is relevant with marketing messages at key news moments.
* Set marketing priorities and collaborate with other teams including membership, customer service, technology, corporate communications, legal and product.
* Prioritize existing workstreams and tasks for the team to ensure on-time delivery and strong execution.
* Forecast, analyze and report on marketing activity effectiveness to senior leadership.
* Analyze market trends and competitors to create ideas that shape the overarching marketing strategy.
* Transform current processes to maximize efficiency across resources both internally and externally, as well as introduce best practices on running marketing projects and delivering campaigns.
* Set the culture for the team, bringing to life company values in everything the team does.
* Connect and communicate the relevancy and impact of industry topics and trends to our business and strategy.
* Team player and ability to make decisions in a fast paced environment.

Qualifications/Requirements:


* A minimum of 15+ years experience working in fast paced marketing teams, ideally for a global subscription company.
* Excellent people manager who loves the challenges that come with building and coaching talent.
* Familiarity with a digital-heavy marketing strategy, and comfort with managing large multi-channel, national campaigns.
* Strong cross-functional partner and experience working with company leadership
* Understanding of and ability to articulate how marketing drives key business results.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills and a confident presenter.
* Ability to manage a budget.
* Creative thinker, ability to provide feedback to agencies to produce work in line with an agreed brief and objectives.

title: Teacher, Preschool (Students or Recent Graduates can Apply)
company: New York Center for Child Development
description:
**New York Center for Child Development** is currently looking to hire a **Preschool Teacher** beginning this **September 2024**. We welcome students who are working towards a Master’s Degree in special education and we also welcome recent Graduates to apply.

We offer a competitive compensation package, as well as a comprehensive benefits package including optional health/dental/vision insurance, 403(b) with generous company match, additional company-sponsored retirement savings plan, pre-tax commuter benefit, and paid vacation/sick/holidays.

**Quality of Work:**

* Designs and Implements Curriculum relevant for the classroom population
* Responsible for a safe and clean environment
* Monthly curriculum is obvious in the classroom environment
* Art reflects children’s work and an open ended philosophy (process not product)
* Curriculum reflects real life experiences for the age level of children in the class
* Curriculum reflects sensitivity and support to cultures represented in classroom community
* Written curriculum provides examples of how to talk with children and engage them at their level
* Curriculum reflects IEP goals of students in the classroom

**Productivity:**

* Works closely with Teacher Assistants daily; and develop monthly curriculum on a monthly basis.
* Provides training for NYCCD, SED, and DOH guidelines for best practice in early childhood education on a weekly basis
* Engages in communication with Teacher Assistants daily regarding specific children and their progress toward IEP goals
* Counsels Teacher Assistants in November regarding their performance in the classroom setting
* Evaluates Teacher Assistants in May
* Interpersonal Relations and Communication
* Acts as the Team Leader for each child in the classroom
* Leads Weekly Team Meetings: Assigns team members as needed for follow up
* Maintains contact with child’s family written and phone keeping them informed of classroom events and school wide events
* Maintains attendance daily calling parent within an hour of start of school if child is absent
* Represents school/child at annual CPSE meetings and requested review meetings
* Informs all team members of any changes in child’s family or health or IEP mandates
* Provides parents with opportunities to influence curriculum development and be part of the classroom

**Reliability and Dependability:**

* Follows school wide Policies and Procedures
* Arrives to work on time ready to engage with students and parents and staff
* Signs in at front office with exact time of arrival and departure
* Calls into front office if absent or running late
* Fills out necessary paper work for planned absences and early leave for school
* Dresses appropriately for working with preschool population
* Seeks out Supervisor when in need of assistance.
* Other duties as assigned to assist in the mission of NYCCD

**One of the Following is REQUIRED:**

* NYS Teaching Certification, Permanent Special Education
* Professional Certification Students with Disabilities (Birth-2nd Grade)
* Initial Certification Students with Disabilities (Birth-2nd Grade)
* **Students who are working towards a Master’s Degree in special education are welcome to apply**

**Preferred Qualifications:**

Bilingual (Spanish) a plus but not essential

**Location:**

Harlem, NY

**About us:**

**New York** **Center for Child Development** is a non-profit organization dedicated to promoting the optimal development of young children. We offer educational and therapeutic services for children from three through age five, and for their parents and the professionals and institutions that serve them. Underlying all our work is the latest academic research and an understanding of the profound effect of early childhood relationships and mental health on all future development and success.

New York Center strives to identify and address developmental and mental health challenges, focusing on children’s interests and strengths and ensuring that the relationships in which they grow are positive and supportive. We are deeply committed to the children we serve and to all children, who will benefit from the advancement of knowledge, training, and public policy we seek.

Our CPSE program is funded and regulated by the New York State Department of Education and, in New York City, by the New York City Department of Education

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $58,000.00 - $68,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Have you ever worked for New York Center For Child Development, OR it's partner agency New York Center For Infants and Toddlers, Inc?
* Are you a student working towards a Master’s Degree in special education?

License/Certification:

* Certification Students with Disabilities (Birth-2nd Grade) (Required)
* NYS Teaching Certification, Permanent Special Education (Required)

title: Citizen Watch Company 5th Avenue Flagship - Watch Repair Technician
description:
**Citizen Watch America** represents the sales and marketing for the Citizen Group within the U.S., Caribbean and Latin American markets. The brands included within Citizen Watch America are Citizen, Bulova, Frederique Constant, Alpina, and Ateliers deMonaco. Each individual brand builds upon their very distinctive identities in the market with their unique, differentiated advertising, marketing and brand campaigns. As a combined company, however, the brands can assist each other and leverage the power that a larger unified entity brings.

Our vision is to lead the affordable luxury watch market by offering the most compelling collection of brands and products that are loved, favored, and respected by citizens of the world.

We will continue to leverage our heritage and expertise to enrich the lives of our current and future customers and Employees through unparalleled excellence in creativity, design, craftsmanship, innovation, technology, value, and service.

**Summary**

The Watch Technician is responsible for providing in-store maintenance/service and performing quality control checks on watches purchased in the Flagship store. The Watch Technician will also act as the liaison with the Customer Care team for all watches sent from the Flagship Store to the Torrance facility for service/repair.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities** *include the following. Other duties may be assigned.*

* Serves as a Brand Ambassador - championing the brands to all customers in person, via computer or phone.
* Communicates recommendations to customers.
* Creates service/repair estimates in system.
* Performs battery installations/changes for watches that were purchased in the Flagship store.
* Sizes, adjusts and repairs bands and band parts, such as pins, links, and clasps.
* Cleans cases and bracelets.
* Performs specialized testing for all water-resistant models.
* Updates data in computer system to track repair work status.
* Supports the needs of the sales floor to ensure all customers have a superior customer experience.
* Suggests ways to improve and promote quality.
* Maintains inventory of all batteries, watch parts/supplies and advises Manager of replenishment needs.

**Qualifications**

* Technical aptitude.
* Detail oriented and well organized.
* Strong English language and grammatical skills; able to interact and effectively communicate information to customers, co-workers, team members, and management.
* Ability to read and comprehend instructions, short correspondence, work rules and procedures.
* Able to work a flexible schedule.
* Able to prioritize and plan work activities and use time efficiently.
* High school diploma or general education degree (GED) and a minimum of three years of related experience and/or training in the field of watch repair, or equivalent combination of education and experience.

EEOE

Pay Range: $18.00 - $20.00/hr

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.00 - $20.00 per hour

title: Car Wash Customer Service Team Member
description:
**Job Description:**

WashHounds Car Wash located in Bayonne is a high volume car wash that is focused on giving our customers the best-in-class service and a sparkling clean car.

We are looking for a part-time or full-time membership salesperson to assist with welcoming customers and membership sales. There are opportunities for advancement for people with great work ethics and even better attitudes. The right person could be a future leader in our growing company.

Starting pay is $16 per hour plus tips, and monthly sales bonus. It is easy to make $20- $25 per hour or more in this position with average tips of $20 to $40 per day. The ideal work schedule is 25 to 40 hours of daytime availability including our busiest days, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.

**Job Duties:**

· Greet and interact directly with our customers, providing friendly service

· Explain our Unlimited Wash Club Membership options

· Possess strong product knowledge and effectively communicate it to customers

· Operate Kiosk, credit card terminals and scanners

· Direct customers safely into the wash tunnel and onto the conveyor

· Deliver an exceptional customer experience by handling the vehicles with care and complying with all WashHounds Car Wash safety policies and procedures

· Additional duties include managing and maintaining the equipment in the tunnel and assisting with property maintenance, snow and ice removal, and overall site appearance

**Benefits Include:**

· Daily cash tips

· Monthly sales bonus

· Health insurance including vision and dental

· Matching 401-K plan

· Tuition Assistance Program

· Paid time off

· Paid sick time

· Free car washes

· Working outdoors

· Career advancement opportunity through our management trainee program

**Tuition Assistance Program:**

· Earn up to $2,500 per year

· Eligible for students at any nationally accredited school, any major or degree program

· Required to submit passing grades (C or above)

**What We're Looking For:**

· The ability to connect with customers

· Sales and strong customer service skills

· Great work ethic and a willingness to learn

· Strong attention to detail and the desire to take pride in delivering a quality service

· Physically able to work on their feet in all weather conditions

This is a fast-paced environment, and we are looking for upbeat team players. Applicants who typically do well in this role have prior experience in customer service, retail sales, health club sales, restaurant, car dealerships, hospitality, military service, high school and college students

Please respond with your resume to schedule an interview.

WashHounds Car Wash is an equal opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Evening shift
* Holidays
* Overtime
* Weekends as needed

title: Veterinarian- Franklin, NJ
description:
**Advanced Veterinary Care** in Franklin, New Jersey is seeking a veterinarian to join our experienced team!


**Advanced Veterinary Care** is a full service small animal hospital just built in 2013 and fully equipped to practice high-quality medicine. Our diagnostic equipment includes an in house Idexx lab (CBC, Chemistry, SNAP tests, blood gas, in house T4, bile acids, and coagulation testing), digital radiography, digital dental radiography, surgical and therapeutic laser, ultrasound, and CT. We have 3 spacious exam rooms all equipped with lift tables and scales.



We have an extremely experienced doctor and support staff team that is excited to mentor a new or recent graduate, or collaborate with another experienced veterinarian. There is high earning potential, as well as flexibility in the schedule!



Benefits include health insurance, 401K, generous continuing education allowance, VIN membership, VetGirl discount, other partner company discounts and reimbursement for membership and license fees. If you'd like to learn more about Advanced Veterinary Care, please email your resume to Carly Hughes at chughes@petvetcarecenters.com or apply at https://www.petvetcareers.com/

title: Veterinarian
description:
Are you a dedicated Veterinarian seeking a dynamic opportunity in a thriving practice? Look no further! We are a well-established, five-doctor practice in  

Westfield, NJ, seeking an enthusiastic and compassionate professional to join our highly tenured team of doctors and technicians. New Grads encouraged to apply!


**About Us:**  

Our practice has been a cornerstone of pet care in Westfield and the surrounding areas for years. With a team of experienced doctors and  

technicians, we are proud to offer comprehensive veterinary services in a caring and supportive environment.


**Why Join Us?**


* **Mentorship:** We believe in fostering growth and development. Our practice has a remarkable track record of providing mentorship, ensuring that new doctors have the support and guidance they need to excel in their careers.
* **Collaborative Team:** Join a team of highly tenured doctors and technicians who are passionate about delivering exceptional care to our furry patients. Collaboration and teamwork are at the heart of our practice.
* **Specialist Partnerships:** We have established partnerships with a traveling cardiologist and a traveling Critical Care specialist, enhancing our ability to provide specialized care to our patients.
* **State-of-the-Art Equipment:** Our commitment to excellence is reflected in our cutting-edge facilities and AAHA accreditation. We boast state-of-the-art equipment, including an Epoc handheld blood analysis tool for rapid results, dental digital radiography, in-house ultrasound equipment, and top-notch boarding facilities.

  

  

**Qualifications:**


* Doctor of Veterinary Medicine (DVM) degree from an accredited institution.
* State licensure to practice veterinary medicine in New Jersey.
* Experience and passion for small animal medicine and surgery.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills with a passion for building  

client relationships.


**What We Offer:**


* Competitive salary with performance-based incentives.
* Comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance, retirement plans,  

and continuing education allowances.
* Collaborative and supportive team environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and career advancement.
* Staff trained in Fear Free

  

  

If you are excited about the prospect of joining a practice that values mentorship, collaboration, and excellence in pet care, we would love to hear  

from you! Please email your resume to Carly Hughes at chughes@petvetcarecenters.com or apply at https://www.petvetcareers.com/.

* Competitive compensation packages, including a generous sign-on/retention bonus.
* Open to both NEW GRADS and experienced DVMs.
* Work closely with our Board Certified Surgeon, Internist, Cardiologist, Ophthalmologist, and Dermatologist for comprehensive patient care.
* Collaborative and supportive environment with routine themed food days/nights.


**Facility and Resources:**


* Fully equipped with digital x-rays, ultrasound, in-house lab (Heska and Idexx machines), feline and canine endoscopy, 4 oxygen cages, and a separate ER surgical suite.
* Highly skilled certified technicians trained in Fear Free handling.


**How to Apply:**



If you are excited about contributing to a dynamic team and providing exceptional emergency veterinary care, please email your resume to Carly Hughes at chughes@petvetcarecenters.com or apply at https://www.petvetcareers.com/.



Learn more about AnimERge at https://animergevets.com/. Join us in fostering a supportive and collaborative environment dedicated to the health and well-being of our team and patients!

  


PetVet Care Centers, Inc. is one of the nation's leading operators of veterinary hospitals for companion animals. The company operates over 450 hospitals across multiple states and employs over 11,000 people including over 800 veterinarians. Since its inception, PetVet has been structured around a model that is focused on developing a partnership between the hospitals and the company and providing the highest quality medicine and service.



PetVet is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, age, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, religion, citizenship, national origin/ancestry, physical/mental disabilities, military status or any other basis prohibited by law. EOE, M/F/D/V

title: Project Accountant
description:
* Brooklyn, NY
* Onsite
* $80,000 - 120,000


  

Our client is a leading specialty mechanical contractor in the New York metropolitan area, uniquely positioned to self-perform HVAC, plumbing, sprinkler, and specialty general construction across both public and private sectors. Our distinguished client base includes top-tier owners, developers, construction managers, and institutions. We deliver comprehensive services with a single point of contact, ensuring quality and excellence in every project from inception to completion. Our commitment to safety, integrity, and exceptional performance is evident in our work on iconic New York State projects such as the Time Warner Building, Rockefeller Center, Lincoln Center, Yankee Stadium, Madison Square Garden, Seven World Trade Center, and Goldman Sachs' Lower Manhattan Headquarters.  

  

**Role Overview**  

As a Project Accountant reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, you will:  

* Apply accounting standards and procedures to handle routine transactions.
* Oversee day-to-day operations of accounting functions including accounts payable, general accounting, or a specific section.
* Manage the preparation, processing, and payment of vendor and subcontractor invoices, client invoices, back charges, bank reconciliations, and petty cash reconciliations.
* Resolve invoice or report discrepancies by coordinating with various departments, project controllers, construction and operations teams, and vendors.
* Suggest cost-effective methods for specific accounting functions to your supervisor.
* Assist with internal and external audits.
* Prepare special reports and undertake additional accounting projects as directed by your supervisor.

**Requirements**  

* Bachelor’s degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, or a related field from an accredited institution.
* Minimum of five years of construction accounting experience.
* Proven experience on projects valued at $150 million or more in the greater NYC area.
* Strong knowledge of general construction accounting, auditing, payroll, and invoicing.
* Ability to maintain data integrity, use data to identify and resolve problems, and plan and prioritize multiple tasks effectively.
* Strong conceptual, analytical, and problem-solving skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

title: Hospice RN Case Manager (Hudson / Bergen County)
description:
**About Us**



Ennoble Care is a mobile primary care, palliative care, and hospice service provider with patients in New York, New Jersey, Maryland, DC, Virginia, and Georgia. Ennoble Care's clinicians go to the home of the patient, providing continuum of care for those with chronic conditions and limited mobility. Ennoble Care offers a variety of programs including, remote patient monitoring, behavioral health management, and chronic care management, to ensure that our patients receive the highest quality of care by a team they know and trust. We seek individuals who are driven to make a difference and embody our motto, "To Care is an Honor." Join Ennoble Care today!

**About the Role:**


Ennoble Care is hiring for a Full-time, Hospice Registered Nurse Case Manager who resides within or in close proximity to Hudson / Bergen County, NJ. As a member of the interdisciplinary team, the RN Case Manager works under the general direction of the Director of Nursing, the attending physician and the interdisciplinary group in providing skilled nursing assessments, planning, and care in order to maximize the comfort and health of both patients and their loved ones/caregivers.



Responsible for identifying patient and loved ones/caregiver needs and for providing supportive care in accordance with the attending physician's orders and plan of care and the policies and procedures. The functions of this position will include the following:


* Shall be assigned patient caseload by the Patient Care Coordinator or designee
* Assume primary responsibility for a patient caseload that includes the assessing, planning, implementing and evaluating phases of the nursing process
* Initiate communication with attending physicians, Hospice staff members and other agencies as needed to coordinate optimal care and use of resources for the patient and loved ones/caregivers
* Maintain regular communication with the attending physician concerning patient and loved ones/caregivers
* Seek input from other team members regarding the patient plan of care to obtain additional knowledge and support
* Provide accurate and timely documentation in electronic medical records.
* Participates in and contributes appropriate information for Interdisciplinary Group meetings
* Accept responsibility for coordinating physical care of the patient by teaching primary caregivers, volunteers, and employed caregivers or by providing direct care as appropriate
* Meet regularly with the Hospice nursing staff to review problems or unique issues from caseloads; share professional support; and exchange feedback aimed toward enhancing professional growth
* Attend patient care conferences and facilitate discussion of issues from caseload for full staff discussion, consultation and evaluation
* Supervise and document the NAC every two weeks or as assigned
* Inform the Patient Care Coordinator of unusual or potentially problematic patient/family issues
* Assume the role of associate nurse when responding to patient/loved ones/caregivers of other primary nurses during on-call time or as requested by the Patient Care Coordinator to fill patient/family needs during the absence of other primary nurses
* Provide appropriate support at time of death and period of bereavement
* Participate in the Hospice orientation and in-service training programs for professional staff
* Participate in agency and community programs as required to promote professional growth and understanding of hospice care
* Maintain familiarity with policies of the agency and rules and regulations of State and Federal bodies which govern hospice
* Accept other assignments as appropriate


**About You:**


* Possession of a current license to practice as a registered nurse in the State of NJ
* At least two years of work experience as a professional nurse preferably at least one of the years in hospice care
* Ability to assess and respond to the needs of patients and loved ones/caregivers in varied settings.
* Skilled in nursing practice, able to cope with loved ones/caregivers' emotional stress and tolerant of individual lifestyles
* Ability to make meaningful observations, skilled assessments, and write comprehensive, accurate reports
* Must be a team player who supports an interdisciplinary team concept of caring for patient and loved ones/caregivers
* Must be fluent in both English and Spanish
* Must have a valid driver's license, a good driving record, the use of a reliable vehicle, and the ability to drive year-round to locations
* Must be able to take direction, work independently and effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team in a positive, professional manner which supports the mission of the organization


#green

**Full-time employees qualify for the following benefits:**


* Medical, Dental, Vision and supplementary benefits such as Life Insurance, Short Term and Long Term Disability, Flexible Spending Accounts for Medical and Dependent Care, Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity.
* Paid Time Off
* Paid Office Holidays


**All employees qualify for these benefits:**


* Paid Sick Time
* 401(k) with up to 3% company match
* Referral Program
* Payactiv: pay-on-demand. Cash out earned money when and where you need it!

title: Tax Director
description:
A renowned organization known for its exceptional service and diverse portfolio of businesses is looking for a leader in their tax department. They are seeking an experienced Global Tax Director to join their dynamic team. This role requires a strong background in both US and international tax regulations, with extensive experience in a Big 4 accounting firm.
  
  

**Job Summary:**  

The Global Tax Director will be responsible for overseeing the companys tax planning, compliance, and reporting functions. This includes ensuring compliance with federal, state, and international tax laws, optimizing tax strategies, and managing relationships with external tax advisors and auditors. The ideal candidate will have a deep understanding of tax regulations, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

* Develop and implement tax strategies to optimize the companys tax position.
* Ensure compliance with all federal, state, local, and international tax regulations.
* Oversee the preparation and review of federal, state, and international tax returns.
* Manage the tax provision process and ensure accurate reporting in financial statements.
* Conduct research on tax issues and provide guidance on tax-related matters.
* Monitor changes in tax laws and regulations and assess their impact on the company.
* Manage relationships with external auditors and tax advisors.
* Coordinate with internal departments to gather necessary information for tax filings and audits.
* Lead and mentor the tax team, providing guidance and support in their professional development.
* Represent the company in tax audits and disputes.


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field; CPA required, advanced degree (MBA or MST) preferred.
* Minimum of 10 years of tax experience, including experience in a Big 4 accounting firm.
* Strong knowledge of US federal, state, and international tax laws and regulations.
* Experience with tax compliance, tax provision, and tax planning.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong leadership and team management abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
* Proficient in tax software and Microsoft Office Suite.

title: Account Manager
description:
**Opportunity: Account Manager**



MiQ is looking for an Account Manager to join our {insert} team. The candidate will be empowered to protect and grow client relationships across a portfolio of advertisers. The role offers the opportunity to join an innovative company, with award winning culture and ambitious growth plans.



The Account Manager will be tasked with growing existing business through delivering best-in-class service for clients, strategic insights presentations, and



upholding internal operational excellence. You’ll have the opportunity to work collaboratively with sales, trading, product and analytics on some of the world’s most known brands.


**WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING**



In the role you will be accountable for, but not limited to, the following:


**Client Service:**


* Craft and present best in class insight reports that blend campaign performance and real business challenges, telling a story with our MiQ data
* Contribute to business retention and growth by identifying incremental opportunities, growing accounts & strategizing new solutions on an ongoing basis, including recommendation of additional products and channels
* Supporting a portfolio of clients and ensuring that all are performing optimally; working in partnership with Trading team to ensure campaigns are pacing as desired


**Project Management:**


* Work hand in hand with regional “pod” to ensure client demands are met and client’s expectations are exceeded. This role is responsible for ensuring all client deliverables are best in class and delivered on time
* Help to identify gaps and establish strategic processes as part of new product rollouts, specifying needs for AM team and any downstream impacts


**Internal Collaboration:**


* Collaborate with internal teams across region(s) to encourage ongoing thought leadership & MiQ product diversification
* Attend all AM-related trainings and completion of Accreditation modules to ensure product knowledge remains current
* Build rapport and foster positive collaboration with the Sales & Trading team on your commercial pod


**Communication:**


* Lead weekly pod syncs and regional Board (client performance review) meetings, keeping all teams aligned on any updates and/or next steps
* Articulating to clients how MiQ’s agnostic approach and Trading technology/ expertise sets us apart
* Collaborate with Senior Team Members across commercial business to provide support on key accounts


**Innovation:**


* Strategize within AM department and the Commercial pod to grow and develop existing client business
* Staying close with clients by reading related company news or industry trades, attend earnings calls to serve as a trusted advisor to both internal teams and clients

  


**YOUR QUALIFICATIONS**


*Experience:*


* Minimum 3 years of advertising technology and/or media planning experience
* Experience with Programmatic Advertising is highly preferred; need for understanding of digital ecosystem and vendor-agency-advertiser dynamic
* Commercial experience – clear evidence of servicing advertisers to a high standard and growing business from “one-time deals” to strategic partnerships measured through revenue and/or business line growth
* A+ presentation skills with the ability to turn data points into a compelling media story.


*Systems:*


* Experience with Google Campaign Manager, Sizmek MDX
* Expertise with the Microsoft Office Suite
* Salesforce, and Atlassian (JIRA) understanding preferred but not required
* Experience with Tag Managements systems a plus!


*Disposition:*


* Alignment with MiQ's core values
* Competitive ‘winning’ mentality with a vision to grow your career as the company scales


**What’s in it for you**  

MiQ is incredibly proud to foster a welcoming culture. We do everything possible to make sure everyone feels valued for what they bring. With global teams committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, we’re always moving towards becoming an even better place to work.


**Values:**



Our values are so much more than statements**.** They unite MiQers in every corner of the world. They shape the way we work and the decisions we make. And they inspire us to stay true to ourselves and to aim for better. Our values are there to be embraced by everyone, so that we naturally live and breathe them. Just like inclusivity, our values flow through everything we do - no matter how big or small.


* **We do what we love** - Passion
* **We figure it out** - Determination
* **We anticipate the unexpected** -Agility
* **We always unite** - Unite
* **We dare to be unconventional** -Courage


**Benefits:**



Every region and office has specific perks and benefits, but every person joining MiQ can expect:


* A hybrid work environment
* New hire orientation with job specific onboarding and training
* Internal and global mobility opportunities
* Competitive healthcare benefits
* Bonus and performance incentives
* Generous annual PTO, paid parental leave, with two additional paid days to acknowledge holidays, cultural events, or inclusion initiatives
* Employee resource groups designed to connect people across all MiQ regions, drive action, and support our communities


**Pay Transparency**



For individuals assigned and/or hired to work in New York City, MiQ is required by law to include a reasonable estimate of the compensation range for this role. This compensation range is specific to New York City and takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. At MiQ, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current compensation range for this position is ***$80,000-$90,000******.***This range may vary for positions outside of New York City as it has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location where the position may be filled and does not take into account our bonus and commission structures.



Regardless of location, candidates can expect during the first few conversations with MiQ’s Talent team and Hiring Managers to share any approved budget and details on our competitive bonus and commission packages. Please take a moment to view the MiQ I.D.E.A. Report to learn more about our approach to creating equitable compensation for our people.


*Apply today*


*Equal Opportunity Employer*


*E-Verify Employer*

title: Laundry Attendant

Bathhouse is a home for people who strive to look, feel and perform their very best. title: Energy Forecast Analyst II
description:
The Energy Forecast Analyst II role provides hydro model expertise and analysis supporting and enhancing the operational performance of NYPA’s Energy Portfolio Modeling & Forecasting team. This position requires working with NYPA’s Engineering department to enhance the accuracy of Hydro flow and internal generation models, with specific focus on the revenue forecasts for the Niagara and St. Lawrence projects that are used for financial planning purposes. Relevant hydro data such as monthly precipitation, water levels, outflows, and analysis of the various Great Lakes basin supply will need to be stored and evaluated to ensure model results consistent with current conditions. The hydro forecasts, and their accuracy, will be tracked and presented to executive management.

  


In addition, the Energy Forecast Analyst II will help support the Energy Commodity Risk Management System (ECRM) used for valuing NYPA’s assets, trade capture, risk, and settlement functions. The analytics associated with these tasks will support strategic business decisions around the asset portfolio and revenue preservation. Overseeing the day-to-day operation of the ECRM includes analysis of routine daily/weekly studies, adhoc evaluations of new products and configurations, working in concert with NYPA IT/contracted vendors, troubleshooting, prepping and implementing annual updates and new model assumptions, etc.

  


Candidates for this role should possess insightful research capabilities, strong technological skills (experience with MS Office, PowerPoint, Excel, and Power BI with knowledge of Python programming a plus), and communication/presentation skills. In addition, the position is responsible for consistent reporting, monitoring performance and managing special projects that will enable the Energy Portfolio Management team to better align with NYPA’s VISION 2030 and business objectives. #LI-VB1  



**Responsibilities**
--------------------


* Support NYPA’s annual/monthly LFRP (Long Range Financial Plan) & COS (Cost of Service) process & deliver required generation dispatch, load forecasts, revenue forecast, fuel expense forecast, capacity forecasts
* Develop PowerPoint Slides, Scatter Plot Analysis, Box and Whisker Charts, Line/Bar Graphs, Tableau Dashboards, Power BI and Excel Macros based on critical information relevant to ERM business line.
* Review & report past transaction performance metrics, variances and KPIs as they relate to NYPA’s portfolios & targets
* Stay current with NYISO procedures, market issues and reports.
* Provide support to internal/external stakeholders for all Market transaction & forecasting related matters, inquiries, and analytics; this includes, Accounting, Financial Planning, Enterprise Risk, Demand Response, Pricing, NYISO, FERC, NERC, NPCC, IOUs, etc
* Work with NYPA’s Engineering department to enhance the accuracy of Hydro flow and internal hydro generation models.
* Track and evaluate relevant hydro data to ensure hydro model results are consistent with current conditions.
* Help oversee and support the Energy Commodity Risk Management System’s (ECRM) deal capture, asset models, and portfolio risk analytics.
* Research, test, & assist in the implementation of updates and changes to the ECRM system.

  




**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**
-----------------------------------


* Knowledge of Wholesale Electricity Market, Fuel Markets and/or associated Financial products.
* Strong business, statistical, financial and reasoning skills
* Advanced analytical and communication skills
* General knowledge of accounting practices
* Strong understanding of the economic impact of decisions within the position’s scope of authority.
* Skilled at adapting, multitasking and performing under pressure
* Able to work independently with minimal daily supervision
* Ability to apply Statistical Analysis and Financial Modeling on relevant data sets
* Knowledge of corporate strategies and goals, market rules and regulations, risk management protocols, and trade life cycle.
* Ability to propose strategies to react to a changing marketplace
* Preferred experience of SAP, Allegro, Ascend, Tableau, Power BI & GE-MAPS
* Preferred experience in database programming and querying using SQL, MS Access, VBA, SAS, Oracle or other.
**Education, Experience and Certifications**
--------------------------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in Business Analytics, Economics, Finance, Accounting, Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics or related discipline required.
* Minimum of 4 years of related experience in an analytical role or equivalent combinations of education & experience.
* Utility or Energy Company experience preferred
**Physical Requirements**
-------------------------



The New York Power Authority is committed to providing fair, competitive, and market-informed compensation. The estimated salary range for this position is: $97,720.00 - $134,360.00. title: Real Estate Buyer's Agent Specialist
description:
Are you determined to help buyers find the home of their dreams? We’re looking for a knowledgeable and enthusiastic buyer’s agent to join our team. You’ll act as the buyer’s main point of contact from the first message to the final sale and ensure they have a positive experience with us. If you’re looking for a position with exponential earning and growth opportunities, we want to hear from you!

Responsibilities:

* Create documents such as representation contracts, purchase agreements, closing statements, deeds, and leases to close the sale
* Provide potential home buyers with pertinent information about their local housing market
* Make sure buyers clients go through a seamless home purchasing process including helping buyers choose mortgage options that fit their budget
* Serve as an intermediary between the buyer and seller or listing agent to ensure mutual transaction satisfaction
* Contact and follow-up with pre-qualified leads to assess their wants and needs in a home

Work Location: On the road

title: Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing
description:
**I.** **Qualifications**
-------------------------



Registered Nurse from an accredited program currently licensed and in good standing with the New Jersey State Board of Nursing, with one year of administrative or supervisory experience in community health programs. Must have strong clinical skills with hospice and/or home health experience. Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills, as well as good community relations. Must have the ability to motivate and work with fellow employees and volunteers. Must be effective in working with different levels of health care providers, and able to express the hospice concept to families, patients, physicians, community, volunteers, staff, and other professionals. This position requires planning, supervision, and administration.


**II.** **RESPONSIBILITIES**
----------------------------



The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing will be responsible for the coordination of the Interdisciplinary Team. The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing acts as a liaison between the IDT and the Executive Director.


**The DCO/DON works in conjunction with the Patient Care Administrator to ensure:**


**A.****Admission, Assignment, Supervision of Staff**



q Monitor to ensure coordination and follow-through is complete for all referrals to the hospice program.



q Assist admission team in coordination and assignment of all newly admitted hospice patients to the appropriate team and/or discipline, i.e., admission nurse, case manager or other RN.



q Work collaboratively with the medical records department to ensure all admission documentation (case sheet, initial assessment, initial plan of care, medication profile, CHHA assignment) is completed within 24-hour period and dispersed among team members.



q Assign a Nurse Case Manager to implement the Plan of Care and oversee the delivery of care to the patient/family!



q Assist the medical records department is monitoring the documentation of all written material related to patient care.



q Act as triage nurse for case managers requiring assistance with symptom management.



q Assist with change in level of care for patients including, locating a facility for placement, ensuring a physician for follow up at the facility, notification of primary care physician and medical director, transport, provision of medications and DME.



q Supervise and evaluate the scheduling of CHHA’s, contract employees, nurse case managers, visiting nurses, continuous care staff, on-call nurses, and medical directors.



q Ensure communication of all patient admissions and changes in Plan of Care is appropriately relayed to each member of the Interdisciplinary Team and Primary Care Physician



q Ensure policies and procedures concerning patient care are followed.



q Ensure and participate in annual evaluation of Nurse Case Managers and CHHA’s and Medical Directors.



q Recruit, hire and train all clinical staff.



q Provide orientation of symptom management and medication utilization to all nurses and physicians.



q Provide and/or assist in ongoing training of clinical staff.



q Participate in the CQI program



q Ensure that the highest ethical standards are practiced throughout the organization.



q Monitor the medication profiles for each patient on service to identify formulary and non-formulary utilization.



q Identify ways to reduce local pharmacy utilization and non-formulary medication utilization.



q Participate with medical directors to ensure appropriate and timely evaluation and treatment of all hospice patients.



q Participate in communication with patients and families with concerns/frustrations related to services and care.



q Provide continuous support to all clinical staff.


**B.****Continuous evaluation of skilled nursing staff and CHHA’s**



q Monitor for and ensure appropriate utilization of “Palliative Pathways” and “Formulary” medications in the care of hospice patients.



q Participates in all IDT meetings in which admissions, certifications, recertifications and medical management of the patients are discussed.



q Coordinate and present or arrange for in-services specific for clinical staff throughout year.


q Meet at least quarterly with skilled nursing staff to discuss job related issues and provide support.



q Meet at least quarterly with CHHA’s to discuss job-related issues and provide support.



q Participate in and/or assist with formal evaluation annually for clinical members of Self Care Managed Team (skilled nurses and CHHA’s)



q Provide annual evaluation for all RNs and LPNs.



q Perform joint visits with case managers and admission nurses at least annually.



q Ensure required supervisory visits are done on a routine basis for all LPN”s and CHHA’s.


**C.****Ensure optimum patient care by:**



q Participating in routine visits and admissions of patients in times of high census or low staff availability



q Participate with the management of admissions and patient care in times of high census or low staff availability.



q Assist in staffing or reassigning visits to other team members when staff member is ill or on vacation.



q Participate with program development, community networking and community/medical staff education to achieve census building.



q Assist with the volunteer and bereavement programs.



q Participate in budgetary decisions related to cost effectiveness, and appropriate decision making by clinical staff, i.e., utilization of pharmaceuticals, DME, and patient care supplies, salary, overtime, etc.



q In the absence of the Administrator, perform administrative duties, as necessary.



q Ensure adequate supervision when utilizing time off.



q Provide input into Policy and Procedure development, i.e., revisions, program development and new markets.


**III.** **ORIENTATION AND TRAINING**
-------------------------------------



Lilycare of New Jersey will provide orientation and training, as necessary, to assist the Patient Care Coordinator in performing the responsibilities listed above. Training’s may be in-house, or outside seminars. Evidence of orientation and training will become part of the personnel file.


**IV.** **On Call**
-------------------



The Director Clinical Operations/Director of Nursing will be on call, as necessary, and will ensure that a trained RN and other patient care staff are available at all times to provide patient care.


**V.** **Accountability**
-------------------------



Reports directly to the Executive Director.

title: Assistant General Manager
description:
About Us



Imagine: 30 unique restaurants to order from, brought to your door in under 30 minutes. That's what our customers experience.



At Wonder, we want to make world-class food within reach, no matter where you live. That's why we've created a vertically integrated, new standard of dining that will allow you to enjoy menus from award-winning chefs and iconic restaurants across the country, all in one place. Our elevated brick + mortar locations will offer pick up and dine in options, as well as delivery to your home.



As a food-tech startup backed by top-tier venture capitalists and led by a team of experienced entrepreneurs—including some of the most accomplished leaders in the technology, culinary, and logistics industries—we're growing. Join us in pioneering a new category of dining called "Fast-Fine", and revolutionizing the way people eat.



About the role



Th Kitchen Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations of their restaurant's back–of–the–house. The Kitchen Manager responsibilities include maintaining a fully stocked kitchen inventory, adhering to safety and sanitation standards. You must be able to lead our kitchen employees and guide them to produce excellent food on time in order to be effective in this position.



In this role, you will


**Manage Operations and Drive Results**


* Support your General Manager to develop, engage, inspire, and motivate staff team members
* Manage and maintain a tight and orderly kitchen operation, including storage, labeling, preparation, and all safety protocols. You are the safety standard bearer, ensuring your team is keeping up with the DOH standards for overall restaurant health.
* Makes an impact on your team by coaching and acting as a role model for the culinary process
* Oversee and uphold food quality and presentation no matter what the business channel is
* Deliver restaurant sales and service times by removing any barriers to success
* Oversee inventory management and food safety to ensure accuracy and efficiency; follow procedures for shelf life and product dating
* Embrace the training and strive for continuous development in the Kitchen to ensure knowledge of all policies, procedures, standards, specifications, and guidelines
* Build your kitchen team by assisting in interviewing, hiring, providing performance improvement, and disciplinary action.
* Schedule daily labor requirements that meet the needs of the business


**Manage Food Safety and Team Member Safety**


* Oversee the quality of the delivered food received from our distribution center, while overseeing inventory, supply, and QA processes in the restaurant.
* Ensure that food safety and security standards are met and adhered to consistently by team members
* Store food products in compliance with safety practices (e.g., in refrigerators, storage room, etc.)
* Keep weekly and monthly cost reports
* Maintain sanitation and safety standards in the kitchen area


The experience you have


* A minimum of 2 years' experience as a kitchen manager/managing back-of-house operations, either in Quick Service Restaurant (QSR) or full-service restaurant
* Ability to work a varying schedule including nights/weekends/holidays
* Ability to work in a standing position for extended periods of time
* Ability to lead and motivate a team in a fast-paced environment
* Excellent verbal, written, and communication skills
* Must be able to lift to 50lbs
* Managed and developed 15+ team members per shift
* Ability to lead and motivate a team in a fast-paced environment
* The ability to take many variables to find the best solution to a problem.
* An eye for detail and solving challenges.
* Food Safety Certification.


Role Detail


* Salary: **$78,750-$87,250**
* Job location: Parsippany, NJ


Benefits



We offer a competitive salary package including equity and 401K. Additionally, we provide multiple medical, dental, and vision plans to meet all of our employees' needs as well as many benefits and perks that are not listed.


**Salary: $78,750-$87,250**


**#IND123**

  

A final note



At Wonder, we believe that in order to build the best team, we must hire using an objective lens. We are committed to fair hiring practices where we hire people for their potential and advocate for diversity, equity, and inclusion. As such, we do not discriminate or make decisions based on your race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, marital status, disability, or any other protected class. If you have a disability, please let your recruiter know how we can make your interview process work best for you.


**We look forward to hearing from you! We'll contact you via email or text to schedule interviews and share information about your candidacy.**
